summary: The Beaches Environmental Assessment and Coastal Health Act of 2025 (or BEACH Act of 2025) amends the Federal Water Pollution Control Act to update grants for beach monitoring programs. The bill focuses on improving water quality monitoring at coastal recreation areas by including nearby upstream waters and clarifying language regarding contamination sources. It also extends the authorization of appropriations for these programs, and directs the EPA to update guidance for states and local governments to reflect advancements in water contamination testing technologies.
